values: I had the most frightening dream.  And I swear I was going wake up screaming.

I watched "Hurt" by Johnny Cash tonight. I had wanted to delete it, but I couldn't. I don't think I've ever been hit as hard by a single song, or video. I always dread thinking that was how my father felt when he was getting old, and dying. That everything around you goes away, and that you will still be standing in the same place. It scares me. It scares me that I will one day think that way, that everything will just come up around me, and I will be left behind. I honestly cannot wait to be old. To tell my stories, and share the times of my life with my grandkids... But I fear being shunned, and put away. I remember what happened to my grampa art. And for what my aunt and uncle did to him, I will never forgive them. At 96, against his will, they threw him in a home. They forgot about him, and left him to die in someone else's care. He died 2 weeks later. I hope my kids will care enough about me to take care of me when I need love around me the most. oh well, I'm definitely getting ahead of myself. Goodnight, bright eyes.

My hair is the shortest it's been in years. At least 4 years. and I have three new holes in my head. Soon to be four. I just had someone confess their love to me. I hate to have him hurt like that. I know what its like to love someone, and them not love you back. I'm sorry. Until about 5 minutes ago, I've been very happy. And I've come to the conclusion that I have a body mod fetish. Yes, I am a freak. And yes... thats just fabulous. One day I'll make mommy proud.
I found a Time Magazine from 1968 today. Jefferson Airplane was on the cover. It was $1. I AM SO HAPPY RIGHT NOW

(I guess I was taking notes in Biology while I wrote this... before this appears in my book, "Pancreas!" & "C6H12O6 - Glucose!" are scribbled about...) I write this knowing you won't see it. Disinterested, sick, I don't know which. But I hope you'll one day know how I feel... how I have always felt. It doesn't matter if you think I lie. I know I don't. You're lovely. You're that I always dreamed of. Through a crowded room, your light shines through the darkened faces. Your smile, no matter what you say, warms my hear on even the coldest of days. Look what you have done to me. A girl, known for being carefree, is now so miserable, and reduced to nearly nothing. She's alone, left in the dark, left to dream of the days before. The days when she was happy. (Then the words, "WHAT HAPPENS NOW?" are literally scratched into the paper. I don't remember writing this, but I must have been pretty bad that day...)

(Recovered. Wow.) "When I cry, they tell me that these are supposed to be the best years of my life. Why would they lie to a girl whose down on her luck? I remember when the best day of my life was yesterday, and the sun was always shining in my mind's eye. Those days have long since left their mark, their snapshots, and their memories. In truth, the days long since passed blanketed my eyes to what could happen, so when it did happen, I was left awe-struck and pining for the past. So what happens to the days past? The days I will remember for the rest of my life? They are in the breat pocket of my father's hospital gown. They sleep in his ashes. My memories of good live in him. But he is tirelessly taunting me with my subconcious, making sure he won't be forgotten. Well, believe me, that;s one reality I will never realize. After leaving all I have ever known, I find myself opening doors expecting to find him on the other side, arms wide with a smile ear to ear; I look at pictures strewn across the house and relive the day, the second it happened, then I always flash to my brother saying his final goodbye to him. He told him it was okay to leave. What lies! He told him we could take care of things and he'd be good for him. Bullshit. What bullshit to say to your dying father. Well, dad, you shouldn't have believed him cuz he just fucked us over. And good try, mom. "You need a father-figure." Yes, to go along with the "best years of my life." My uncle will never be a father figure to me. I love him unconditionally, but I have to face the fact that I'm going to have a void in my life too big to cover with an uncle. Bottom Line: I miss my father like a hobo misses clean underwear. God, bring this hobo's undies back to her." (Old journal entry. Crazy, yes. I remember writing this. I was sitting on my bed, laying my head on the wall. I was crying, of course, and I kept getting uncontrollably angry. My teeth were gritting and my fists were clenching. I thought I was going to punch through a wall. Mostly all over the part about my brother. Yeah.)

(I don't know when I wrote this, I found it in my superman notebook... among other things..) "Creative outlet My only friend You'll never betray me You can always mend My aches and my pains Fill that gray space inside Yet you always give me a place I feel safe in to hide O, my creative outlet What would I do without you? I sometimes fear I'd be normal And lose my twisted view askew. -------------------------------- Footnote: Note the creative use of a Kevin Smith Enterprise? Much booyah. " (I think I was on something when I wrote that... hah.)

(Ain't it funny how all the depressing ones come from 6th period?) A note never delivered A letter to no one words that are all of me but meaningless to someone This paper full of nothing The nothing that kills me so slow Sits at the bottom of my pocket It's contents never to be known My words of memories and of times long past Live only on that paper But in my mind will last A piece of paper Covered in blood Dries up in my pocket And turns into mud My words are on paper Paper you'll never see Words of my love Which will never cease to be The words catch fire and burn through a hole It singes through its pocket And falls to the floor.

Control has been shifted I hold the gun My worries have lifted As I watch the rising sun You're shaking beneath me Under the weight of my thumb Frightened, trying to see Praying to God to be numb The sun hides away shielding from my power Beneath a cloud it lays Too ashamed to cower The cloud blocks the light The only source of my brawn The dark sweep blinds my sight And interrupts the creeping dawn You soar high above me The blackness on your side Your power overtakes me and rises like the tides My control has been lifted You hold the gun My worries have shifted As I watch the dying sun I'm shaking beneath you Under the weight of your thumb I shudder at what is to ensue I pray to God to be numb (c)!

* * * * * * I'm a burden. Thorn in everyone's side. Why don't I take my own advice? Why don't I listen to myself for a change? What if I made a point? What if I knew what I was talking about? What if? What if? What if? That is all that surrounds me now. What if I was who I once was? What if I was lovely? What if I had said no? What if I had done what I knew was right? What if I had stayed instead of left you there? What if you had loved me? What if I ended it all with one blow? What would happen then? What if you missed me when I'm gone? ------------------------------------> Impossible to tell the sickening truth from the blissful blanket of lies. But who needs truth when the lies are so inviting? If I could live in a world full of your lies, I would be perfect; I would be your queen; I would be surrounded by the beauty of my dreams; I would feel loved; I would be happy. But the lies, no matter how comforting, are nothing more than a storybook. The fiction you wrote for me to live by. To walk my days with white satin-cloaked eyes, candy coated to a bittersweet serenity. But what am I to do when the book closes and you're through with this child's play? Am I to end like my fairytale? ---------------> Sleep once more. The day was more than cruel to you. Its what you deserve. A sweet release from the everyday. A calm hiding within the writhing pit of the storms. Dream away, my love. Here I will lie. Forever by your side. Never to headline in the marquee of your dreamworld. Sleep sweet, my love, its the only way you know to drown me out. ---------------------->
Disclaimer: (the above were written last night before I went to sleep. They're not directed at anyone, actually.. I was REALLY pissed off, and I just needed to do something to keep from hurting myself. And they also look alot better written in my notebook. Appearance is a powerful literary device.)

She was caught.
It had taken them years to track her.
She knew how to cover herself;
She knew what she was doing.
She slipped up once,
and that was enough.
They took her in,
ball and chain.
Threw her down
and clipped her wings.
She jumped and screamed
And battled and shook.
But they had all left her.
They left her tied down,
without chance of escape.
they sealed the cages
and they hid her away.
So there she sits
thoughtless and numb
dreaming of the days before
when she could fly like the rest
before she got caught.
--------------------->

A life
A single life time
To be wasted in one
continuous comedy of errors
Is not a life at all.
Although there is comedy
amidst the countless errors,
I never see it.
The humor is unsaught.
All I see is error,
all I let myself see
is the error I've become.
a tragedy of errors
seems more suited
for a life as staid
as the one i drag myself through.
-------------------------------->

An ivory feather rests on the water.
It is well travelled,
Having stolen many rides from passerby breezes.
But those days are gone.
The water swells the bottom of the feather
It made a wrong move coming here.
Its simple independency is now as futile
As its escape from this pool.
The trees bid their farewell. 
---------------------------->

A phone rings in my head.
Yet on the line, all I hear
is a droning buzz.
A doorbell sounds in my ears.
Yet beyond my closed door
lies only the blowing leaves.
A door closes in my mind's eye.
Yet no one has come
or gone in weeks.
A voice calls out to me
and echos through me wholly.
Yet no one has said my name.
--------------------------->

new years was mas w00t. I just spoke 3 languages. hah! okay, anyway, I went to Amanda's to spend the night. It was pretty cool. We destroyed barbie's (great way to de-stress), watched Edward Scissorhands, then right after midnight we went out in the parking lot and threw poppers! Some chick was out there and introduced herself, and i think she thought I was stoned off my ass. I was going nuts. Then we went in, cuz it was colder than martha stewart outside. Then out came the bacardi rum and the cinnamon schnapps. And it was all for me! She had some pot, and I wasn't interested, so I just got shitfaced and smoked a cigarette. I don't really remember much after that, besides talking alot. hah. I guess I thought I could drink my problems off my mind... but fuck... all I did was talk about michael. hahaha, I'm a fuckin waste of time. Amanda said I woke up to go to the bathroom, and I got up out of the bed, then fell back over and ran into the doorway. hahahaha... me drunk amuses the stoned. eh, it was a good time. Her mom is so great tho... She so knew mandy was smoking in her room... she didn't do anything. hahahaha it was her mom's pot anyways.. ehh, just a mild bender to start off the new year, and I really fuckin needed it to loosen me out. But I guess I got too loose, cuz I'm hungover today. I can't walk up the stairs right,haha. I have to go to the hennings later on, and someone is gunna call me on it... them and their 3 story house!! damnit!! yargh, I need to go make myself useful somehow. and I'd like to apologize if anyone tried to call my cellphone last night, I had shit reception where I was... oh well... I really wanted to go to that party at that chick Jen's house.. that made me real sad. oh well, peace out homeskilletslicers.. and make this year a good one.

Well, it turns out michael and i really didn't know each other. I knew we didn't know as much about each other as we should, but I didn't realize it was so bad until last night. We had come to the agreement to call it quits, and get to know each other first. But he asked me if I was okay with it, and I said I was fine with it. Then he asked, "Are you sure?" and I said yes. He didn't even know me well enough to tell when I'm lying through my teeth. I cried myself to sleep last night. Honestly, I have never cried that much, I thought something was wrong with me. I didn't even cry that much at the hospital when my dad died. When I woke up this morning, I looked in the mirror, and my eyes are swollen, almost shut. I hadn't had an idea of how much I truly cared about michael until last night. Shame he'd never read this, right? I wish I knew how he was acting last night as we were talking. I'm sick and tired of AIM. I wish you could express true emotion on it, but I'm fed up. Anytime any of you want to talk to me, PICK UP THE GODDAMN PHONE. Maybe if we had talked on the phone, he would have realized how blatantly I was lying, and how much I was crying... oh well, it's too late now. Another piece broken off, another scar left behind. -----The workers are going home-------->

If I were a stone, I would be: a Quartz If I were a tree, I would be: a Palm If I were a bird, I would be: a crow If I were a machine, I would be: A camera If I were a tool, I would be: a monkey wrench ;) If I were a flower/plant, I would be: a yellow tulip If I were a kind of weather, I would be: a sunny day with a cool ocean breeze If I were a mythical creature, I would be: a mermaid If I were a musical instrument, I would be: a harp If I were an animal, I would be: a fox If I were a color, I would be: pink If I were an emotion, I would be: joy If I were a vegetable, I would be: a peapod! If I were a sound, I would be: a whistle If I were an Element, I would be: Wind If I were a car, I would be: an old cruddy cadillac, like my grampa's old one that he sold for $75! If I were a song, I would be: strawberry fields by the beatles If I were to trade places with another person, it would be: I wouldn't really want to, but if someone had a gun to my head saying, "WHO WOULD YOU SWITCH WITH, BITCH?!", I'd say, "The lead singer of The Used!!! or John Lennon, if I wouldn't get shot! Don't shoot me!" If I were a movie, I would be: Dazed and Confused If I were a food, I would be: a chocolate covered strawberry If I were a place, I would be: key west If I were a material, I would be: silk If I were a taste, I would be: mesquite ;) If I were an object, I would be: a light bulb If I were a word, I would be: splendiforus If I were a body part I would be: an apposable thumb If I were a facial expression I would be: a look of laughter If I were a cartoon I would be: White Debbie (hahahaha) If I were a shape I would be: a star If I were a number I would be: 13 If I were a month I would be: November If I were a day of the week I would be: Saturday If I were a time of day I would be: Dusk If I were a direction I would be: East If I were a piece of furniture I would be: a worn-in arm chair If I were a sin I would be: gluttony If I were a historical figure I would be: Ansel Adams If I were a liquid I would be: rain If I were a method of death I would be: homocide If I were a planet I would be: Neptune If I were a scent I would be: Clinique's 'Happy' If I were a sea animal I would be: a dolphin

No.  Not nice.  What I had feared actually happened.  I was in my room with my headphones on laying down, and I walked out to get a glass of water, and guess who's ugly face i recognized even without my glasses.  Matthew's..  what a nice holiday surprise.  Fuck.

I'm tired as hell, so I'm going to bed.

My mom is at a doctor's appointment, so I have some freetime to contemplate things that have really been bugging me. Well, for the first time today, just like I was told, I thought of some of the really good times my dad and I shared, and I laughed instead of cried. It felt rewarding, actually. I thought of one night where him and I sat on the porch wall, back when we still had one, and we watched a thunderstorm. And, as you all probably know, when there is a thunderstorm in Florida, it's a THUNDERstorm. We had just sat there for a good two hours and watched the lightning together. And a few other nights, my dad and I sat out there and talked. We talked about anything and everything. I remember the porch at my house in Florida was such a great hang out... whenever anyone came over, we wound up sitting out there and bullshitting. Good times. No calls from Matt yet today. I'm hoping he got arrested last night. ;) "Everytime I run away, it's easier to stay."----

A new lj. A new format...  And good grammar!

Lately, I've been a mixture of really pissed off, and really sad.  Matt called a bunch of times today.  Thats one reason I'm pissed off/sad.  He's spending the holidays in South Florida, hanging out with my friends, and enjoying the high life.  He called me the other day from the side of Atlantic Blvd. to say that he saw Kelsey the night before, and that Florida is so gorgeous, and he was going to the beach..  ugh.  I made up some bright excuse to get off the phone.  I honestly don't want to say it, but I have to come to terms with it:  I really hate my brother.  He messes with me too much, and I don't think I deserve to sit through it anymore.  I've matured and developed a mind of my own, and that mind tells me to ignore his shit.  And so I will do.

Yesterday was my dad's 9 month anniversary.  That may have been a reason why I didn't feel like getting out of bed yesterday.  And I didn't.  I can't believe it has been that long already.  Time really flies when you're trying to ignore it.  Can you believe I've lived here for 6 months?  I surely can't.  But like I told Karli earlier, I'm still in a state of denial.  I think my October trip home really helped that denial too.  Oh well, I'm going to come home to stay.  And when I finally do, I'm not leaving.
